transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Hello everyone. Today we're going to talk about growth mindset.

transcript.speaker: Member1
transcript.text: What's that?

transcript.speaker: SYSTEM
transcript.text: [13 turn(s) omitted]

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Sure. Like, if you're bad at something, instead of saying 'I'm bad at this,' you say 'I'm not good at this yet.' The word 'yet' is important.

transcript.speaker: Member2
transcript.text: That makes sense.

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Good. So everyone understand? Great. Let's continue.

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: According to the research, the brain can change. It's kind of like a muscle in that way. When you practice, you get better.

transcript.speaker: SYSTEM
transcript.text: [1 turn(s) omitted]

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Well, you can improve at anything. That's the main idea here.

transcript.speaker: Member3
transcript.text: I've been really stressed about exams.

transcript.speaker: SYSTEM
transcript.text: [2 turn(s) omitted]

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: There are lots of apps for meditation. And for sleep, try to avoid screens before bed. Good sleep hygiene is really important for academic performance.

transcript.speaker: Member1
transcript.text: What about anxiety medication?

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: That's something you'd need to talk to a doctor about. I can't really advise on that. But lifestyle changes like exercise can help too.

transcript.speaker: Member5
transcript.text: My parents put a lot of pressure on me to get good grades.

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: That's a common issue. Parent pressure can be difficult. Have you tried talking to them about how you feel? Communication is important in families. Sometimes parents don't realize the impact of their expectations.

transcript.speaker: SYSTEM
transcript.text: [7 turn(s) omitted]

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Does everyone understand the concept now? Any questions?

transcript.speaker: Member4
transcript.text: I think I get it.

transcript.speaker: Member1
transcript.text: Yeah, makes sense.

transcript.speaker: SYSTEM
transcript.text: [7 turn(s) omitted]

transcript.speaker: Fellow
transcript.text: Alright, I think that covers it. Thank you for your attention today. See you next session.

transcript.speaker: Member6
transcript.text: Thanks.
